title: Season Preview tab in The Lab teams page (Magazine-quality UI)
description: Build a Season Preview tab as the default/first tab in The Lab teams page. Display the full editorial season preview (from outputs/season_previews/) as a magazine-quality, Lindy's/Phil Steele style page. Requirements: (1) All editorial content available with collapsible read-more sections, (2) Tables formatted visually with colored cells, badges, and visual hierarchy — not plain tabular, (3) Abbreviations and key stats highlighted with accent colors, (4) Mobile and desktop optimized, (5) Follows existing Lab design system (CSS variables, dark/light theme). RCB is the first team; other teams show 'Coming Soon' placeholder.

florentino_gate.reason: Season preview display is the core product showcase — this IS the magazine.

domain_sanity.notes: Jayson Tatum verified magazine-quality UI. Kevin De Bruyne confirmed responsive design and collapsible sections.

enforcement.notes: Tom Brady: Preview tab successfully integrated as default tab in teams.html. RCB preview rendering correctly.

progress_notes.approach: New Preview tab as first/default tab. Data stored in season_previews.js, rendered by renderPreviewPanel(). Collapsible sections, magazine-quality tables, bold take card, scouting report, category ratings with visual loader bars.
progress_notes.agents: Kevin De Bruyne (Visualization), Jayson Tatum (UX/Reader Flow)
progress_notes.design_patterns: Reusing existing Lab CSS variable system, expandable pattern, responsive breakpoints
progress_notes.v2_improvements: Justified text alignment across all prose. Category ratings redesigned as collapsible cards with shimmer loader bars and metric badges. Table last-column wrapping. Section summaries visible on mobile (2-line clamp). Better font sizing hierarchy.
